Title: Object: Buonaparte pardonnant aux révoltés du Caire
Description: Napoleon Bonaparte forgiving the insurgents in Cairo on 22 October 1798, after Guérin; the general stands at left while an Egyptian man, perhaps an interpreter, addresses the rebels who have been gathered at right; a soldier is seen untying one of the insurgents. c.1825 Etching and engraving
Producer name: Print made by: Jean Nicolas Lerouge (etching)
Bibliographic references: IFF / Inventaire du Fonds Français: Bibliothèque Nationale, Département des Estampes (13) (under Lerouge)
Associated names: Representation of: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
Associated events: Associated Event: Napoleon's campain in Egypt (Insurrection in Cairo) 1798 (22 October)
